page.title: 04AN OLD AGE PENSIONER'S DAY
page.content: Sheltered housing is a small flat within a block. Heating and some furniture are provided but most people use their own. There is a communal lounge where you meet the other residents. A warden keeps an eye over everyone. I interviewed Mrs Milne. She does her own shopping, and has a homehelp. Mrs Milne thinks sheltered housing is a good thing and its comfortable. She thinks her house is big enough.It has two rooms,a living room,kitchen and a bedroom. Mrs Milne has meals on wheels on Tuesday and Friday.And has many visitors calling. I interviewed Mrs Morrison who lives in an ordinary house and is married.Mr and Mrs Morrison get Â£59.00 pension to share between them every week.
